moves.1. d4: Well I've never done this before, figured since it was one of my better games I'd give it a shot. I think this is the first game I've opened d4
moves.1... c5 2. e4: I just tried to develop the center of the board here
moves.2... cxd4 3. c3 dxc3 4. Nxc3 Nf6 5. Bc4: right here I was aiming to trap his Nf6 by advancing my pawn e5
moves.6... h6 7. Bh4 Bb4: I succeeded here, by advancing the pawn and he countered with g5, I didn't want him castling
moves.8. e5 g5: so I exf6 and knew now that he wasn't going to castle, successfully atleast
moves.9. exf6 Bxc3+ 10. bxc3 gxh4 11. Qf3 Qc7: here I was just looking to protect the c3 pawn from
moves.13. Ne2 Rg6 14. Bc2: just trying to attack until something comes up
moves.14... Rg5 15. O-O Nc6 16. Nf4: Here I was looking for a sacrifice of either my knight or bishop just attacking the f7 pawn and taking it with the queen later on to check him
moves.16... Qe5 17. Nh3 Rg8 18. Rfe1 Qc5 19. B: here I didn't really have much
moves.20. Be4 Ne5: at this point I saw it was a good time to start attacking
moves.21. Qh5 Nd3: once he attacked the rook I saw potential mate 4-6 moves ahead. I knew it looked to good for him not to pass it up so I moved Ng5 hoping that he would take my rook. If he didnt and took my g5 Knight I knew I'd be at -1 in the same spot as I was before
